clinical_study.brief_title: Optical Coherence Tomography in Patients With Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Live Laser Microscopic Evaluation (OCT) of Radiation Induced Preclinical Alterations of the Skin in Head and Neck Cancer Patients

collaborator.agency: Verein zur Forschungsförderung der Krebshilfe OÖ
Johannes Kepler Universität Linz, Abteilung FLLL

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether any eventual skin damage caused by radiation therapy can be detected and monitored at a subclinical level via optical coherence tomography (OCT). Another key question is whether subclinical OCT detected skin damage correlates with acute and late clinical toxicity.

detailed_description.textblock: Head and neck cancer patients that meet the eligibility criteria and singned the informed consent will undergo OCT-measurements before, during and after the course of radiation therapy. At the same time-points the skin areas are evaluated with dermatoscopy and patients are asked to self-assess their quality of life (EORTC QLQ C30 and respective head and neck module H&N 43). Before the onset of radiation therapy radiation sensitivity analysis will be performed with in-vitro irradion of peripheral blood lymphocytes (FISH).

primary_outcome.measure: early radiation induced skin structure changes detected in OCT
primary_outcome.description: any reproducible difference in skin OCT appearance as compared with baseline (pre-RT)

secondary_outcome.measure: detection of any skin strucure changes with OCT during the course of RT
secondary_outcome.description: any reproducible difference in skin OCT appearance as compared with baseline (pre-RT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of OCT changes with clinical appearent acute side effetcs
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of OCT changes with CTC radiation toxicity

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of OCT changes with clinical appearent late side effetcs
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of OCT changes with CTC radiation toxicity

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of OCT changes with radiation sensitivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: OCT: weeks 1-6 of radiation therapy; FISH: pre-RT
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of OCT with chromosome-breaks per metaphasis in in-vitro irradiated blood lymphocytes (FISH)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of OCT changes with dermatoscopic skin appearance
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of OCT changes with standardised evaluated skin appearence via dermatoscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of quality of live with OCT and radiation sensitivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: weeks 1-6 of RT, 6 weeks and 1 year post-RT
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of quality of live as measured with the EORT QLC C30 and Head and neck module H&N 43 with OCT and radiation sensitivity

arm_group.description: Patients with adjuvant or definitve radiotherapy or radio-chemotherapy for head and neck cancer

intervention.description: 3x3 OCT volume scans on treated and opposite side of the irreadiated area on head and neck
Blood sample is examined for breaks per metaphase to determine radiation sensibility of the individual

study_pop.textblock: Consecutively treated patients with head and neck cancer at the department of radiation therapy Ordensklinikum Linz Barmherzige Schwestern

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cancer located at: nasopharynx, oropharynx, hypopharynx, larynx, oral cavity and definitive or adjuvant radiation- or radio-chemotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- reduced mental capacity
- treatment with C225 Cetuximab
- bearded patients
- overt skin disease
- vast tattoos in the neck region
